fields.Title: INVENTORY / GREATEST INNOSSENCE
fields.Description: "The Greatest Innocence" by João Paolo Salomao Lopez de Fuego.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "A strange sensation of loss. When s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A strange sensation of loss. When she left the Earth, the dust and the ice and the humans... That is unimportant to the quiz. Stop thinking about this.

fields.Title: You: "Sola?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Sola?

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Incorrect. Sola was anointed during..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Incorrect. Sola was anointed during the previous century and even lived to see the current one.  She was an urban planner who spoke her mind and largely left history to its own devices, encouraging people to excel on their own rather than prescribing to a deified model of history. She is often called an *anti-innocence*.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Incorrect. Dolores Dei was the inno..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Incorrect. Dolores Dei was the innocence of humanism, internationalism, and the welfare state. She codified parliamentary democracy and created modern institutions, among these the Moralintern. She was powerful. And beautiful, on all her icons...

fields.Title: You: "Dolores Dei."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dolores Dei.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "The most famous -- and important --..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The most famous -- and important -- of these  was Ernö Pasternak. He was into torture, despotism, hymns, cannons, and world conquest, but got defeated and humiliated by Stepan the Despicable of Kedra.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Got it under control. No problem. S..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Got it under control. No problem. Solid on this one. It's wide-spread historical information.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Correct! There have been a number o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Correct! There have been a number of counter- or false-innocences -- some assumed to have innocentic qualities, some who just thought so themselves. Occasionally they have the support of a faction inside the ecclesiastic organization, and accusations of foul play have arisen...

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "Dolores..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dolores...

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "Dora..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dora...

fields.Title: You: "Oh god no, let me out of here."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh god no, let me out of here.
fields.Alternate1: Nah, one triumph is good enough for me.
fields.Alternate2: Fuck no, I'm not falling for your trickery again.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Disappointing. You'll never get any..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Disappointing. You'll never get anywhere with that attitude.
fields.Alternate1: Smarmy jerk. Bet you just got lucky that first time around anyway. Or you cheated off someone smarter.
fields.Alternate2: Probably for the best. It wasn't looking too good for you, anyway.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Correct! Named the innocence of mil..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Correct! Named the innocence of militarism, he codified hereditary rule -- but at the same time ended serfdom and established the interisolary reál as the global reserve currency. He also established the concept of the Nation.

fields.Title: You: "Ernö Pasternak?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Ernö Pasternak?

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "There seems to be a mix-up with the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There seems to be a mix-up with the sources. It's not my fault.

fields.Title: Horrific Necktie: "Man, something's weird about this b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Man, something's weird about this book. You should do something fun instead. Rock out, forget about it.

fields.Title: You: "Not thinking about it. Not thinking..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not thinking about it. Not thinking about it. Back to quiz.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Correct! Nothing much is known abou..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Correct! Nothing much is known about him. It's not even clear that he was a *he*, but Franconegro presumed as such and called him Pius. He's depicted as a young man with molten gold pouring out of his mouth -- all he spoke was gold. It's said he *invented* god; and equality of men before god. He also introduced the gold standard as a way for measuring people's love for aurum.

fields.Title: You: ""Still got it, book!""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Still got it, book!"
fields.Alternate1: "Got you this time! Not so smart anymore, are you?"
fields.Alternate2: "Aced again! You're no match for me, book."

fields.Title: Half Light: "Thanks for nothing."
fields.Dialogue Text: Thanks for nothing.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Who knows? You feel like you *lost*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Who knows? You feel like you *lost* her somehow. When she left the Earth, the dust and the ice and the humans... This is unimportant to the quiz. Stop thinking about this.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Oh yeah, this is what I was made fo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh yeah, this is what I was made for.

fields.Title: You: "That so? Alright, go on, give me al..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That so? Alright, go on, give me all the hints you got.

fields.Title: You: "Doesn't sound too familiar to me, s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Doesn't sound too familiar to me, shoot me a hint.
fields.Alternate1: Sure, try again. I trust you've got my back.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Final stretch, you've come so far a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Final stretch, you've come so far and learned so much. This is the most important one. Question 4: Who was the *greatest* innocence? The most *important* of them all. The most precious to human kind...

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Zero doubts."
fields.Dialogue Text: Zero doubts.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "... an A. All correct. Impressive,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: ... an A. All correct. Impressive, *oddly* so.
fields.Alternate1: ... an F! For *Failure*. Ha ha ha.
fields.Alternate2: ... a D. Not particularly remarkable, but technically a passing grade. Not that anyone really expected better.
fields.Alternate3: ... a C. Vaguely passable. A solid effort with nothing much else to show. Nice going, mediocrity-man.
fields.Alternate4: ... a B. Good enough. Everyone misses a few from time to time.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A-ha." The lieutenant looks at you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A-ha." The lieutenant looks at you with his usual lithic mask of a face.

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "Dolores Dei! Dolores..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dolores Dei! Dolores...

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "While it was actually her..."
fields.Dialogue Text: While it was actually her...

fields.Title: You: "Vesper-Messina?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Vesper-Messina?

fields.Title: You: "Sigh internally."
fields.Dialogue Text: Sigh internally.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Yeah, sure. It's so much easier onc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yeah, sure. It's so much easier once you know the answers, right?

fields.Title: You: ""Good enough! Take that, you book.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Good enough! Take that, you book."

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "You would have done better if you'd..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You would have done better if you'd just dial the Dolores Dei down a bit.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Franconegro attempted to solve the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Franconegro attempted to solve the rising tensions between the aristocracy and bourgeoisie by building a unified society, in which every man has a place and a mission, but at the same time may rise to nobility provided on the strength of his virtue.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "You are shouting at an inanimate ob..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You are shouting at an inanimate object like a real weirdo. No wonder you seem to have trouble with the right answers.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Browsing through the various chapte..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Browsing through the various chapters, you try your best to understand the ceaseless overflow -- the sprawl -- of names, dates, places, events historical. Most of it ends up as a twisted mass of facts inside your brain.
fields.Alternate1: Browsing through the book again, you still have trouble understanding the torrent of information. It only seems to add to the confused jumble of facts inside your brain.

fields.Title: (Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 6  or  Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 4  or  Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 2)  and  (Variable["doomed.greatest_did_dolores_twice"]  or Variable["doomed.greatest_clicked_on_dolores_once"] )

(Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 6  or  Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 4  or  Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 2)  and  (Variable["doomed.greatest_did_dolores_twice"]  or Variable["doomed.greatest_clicked_on_dolores_once"] )

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: (Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 6  or  Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 4  or  Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 2)  and  (Variable["doomed.greatest_did_dolores_twice"]  or Variable["doomed.greatest_clicked_on_dolores_once"] )

fields.Title: !((Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 6  or  Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 4  or  Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 2)  and  (Variable["doomed.greatest_did_dolores_twice"]  or Variable["doomed.greatest_clicked_on_dolores_once"] ))

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: ((Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 6  or  Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 4  or  Variable["doomed.book_gi_wrong_counter"] > 2)  and  (Variable["doomed.greatest_did_dolores_twice"]  or Variable["doomed.greatest_clicked_on_dolores_once"] )) == false

fields.Title: You: "You're *absolutely* certain of this..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You're *absolutely* certain of this?

fields.Title: You: "No."
fields.Dialogue Text: No.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh-kay." The lieutenant stares at..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh-kay." The lieutenant stares at you, his visage unflinching.

fields.Title: You: ""Aced that. Take that, you book.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Aced that. Take that, you book."

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Yes. The quiz is impersonal. No nee..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes. The quiz is impersonal. No need to rouse *sensations* in yourself at the mention of Dolores Dei. Who was the *first* innocence -- it wasn't Dolores Dei...

fields.Title: Logic: "Yes. Obviously."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes. Obviously.

fields.Title: You: "Dolores Dei?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Dolores Dei?

fields.Title: You: "You sound confident, go right ahead..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You sound confident, go right ahead -- a hint would come in handy.
fields.Alternate1: Okay, are you sure *this* time? I'll bite. Hint me.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "As the first innocence, he declared..."
fields.Dialogue Text: As the first innocence, he declared that there should be more of those like him. It is presumed his disciples were the beginning of the Holy Party (the Founding Party).

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant is doing his best to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant is doing his best to ignore your behaviour.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Incorrect again. While she originat..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Incorrect again. While she originated many modern institutions, launched several successful expeditions, and was even critical of the innocentic system itself -- and *somehow* keeps popping up in your mind! -- she is not often considered the *strongest*.

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "Okay. It wasn't Dolores Dei. She's..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Okay. It wasn't Dolores Dei. She's not false.

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "And more beautiful, and *more* beau..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And more beautiful, and *more* beautiful...

fields.Title: You: "The Perikarnassian?"
fields.Dialogue Text: The Perikarnassian?

fields.Title: You: "All news to me, so maybe a few hint..."
fields.Dialogue Text: All news to me, so maybe a few hints?
fields.Alternate1: You going to be helpful this time? I could use a hint.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Of course! This is my *thing*, the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Of course! This is my *thing*, the reason I exist in this world. The correct answer is Franconegro.

fields.Title: You: "You know, I didn't really absorb an..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You know, I didn't really absorb anything from what I just read.

fields.Title: You: ""The book is unfair.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "The book is unfair."

fields.Title: You: ""Thinks it's so smart, god damn...""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Thinks it's so smart, god damn..."

fields.Title: Endurance: "You can do it. It'll be worth it. T..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You can do it. It'll be worth it. There's something here.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Steer clear of this one. There's so..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Steer clear of this one. There's something terrible about this one.

fields.Title: You: "Dolores Dei?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Dolores Dei?

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "A pop quiz is a short examination d..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A pop quiz is a short examination designed to test your knowledge without any prior warning or announcement. Such exams allow the teacher to assess how thoroughly the students have retained the material at hand -- voila! Now blast that first innocence!

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Question 2: Who was the strongest i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Question 2: Who was the strongest innocence?

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Damn."
fields.Dialogue Text: Damn.

fields.Title: You: "Crack open this immense tome."
fields.Dialogue Text: Crack open this immense tome.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Easy! Everybody knows the answer to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Easy! Everybody knows the answer to this. You, me, anybody.

fields.Title: You: "Kedra?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Kedra?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant is tapping his foot,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant is tapping his foot, but you can't tell if it's a habitual tic or impatience.

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "Dolores Dei!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Dolores Dei!

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Incorrect. Vesper-Messina is not a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Incorrect. Vesper-Messina is not a person, but a defunct state on the southeastern coast of the Occident. It used to take up most of the peninsula, before separating into the Republics of Vesper and Messina. Care to try again?

fields.Title: You: "Stepan the Despicable?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Stepan the Despicable?

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Everything from interisolary travel..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Everything from interisolary travel, to the connected world, to three consecutive scientific revolutions can be traced back to her. Every decade that passes she seems less human somehow -- and more beautiful...

fields.Title: You: ""Never mind. Thinking aloud.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Never mind. Thinking aloud."

fields.Title: You: ""Damn you, you arrogant book.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Damn you, you arrogant book."

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "But endless tries aren't really fai..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But endless tries aren't really fair, don't you think?

fields.Title: You: "[Put the book away.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Put the book away.]

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Please. Relax."
fields.Dialogue Text: Please. Relax.

fields.Title: You: "What?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What?

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "No. Stop thinking it. I said it was..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No. Stop thinking it. I said it wasn't her. She was true.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "You really navigated some treachero..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You really navigated some treacherous waters here. Well done.

fields.Title: You: "Yes. Immensely."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes. Immensely.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: ""The Greatest Innocence" by João Pa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Greatest Innocence" by João Paolo Salomao Lopez de Fuego. The book is large and heavy.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Your educational survey is done. Di..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your educational survey is done. Did you catch any of that? No? Oh well, it's pop quiz time! Let's see what you've learned. This might take a few minutes. You ready?

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Even though the words most associat..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Even though the words most associated with her rule are *l'amour, la compassion, l'autodiscipline* -- love, compassion, self-control -- which could be seen as facets of strength. Would you like to try again?

fields.Title: You: "Sure, why not?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Sure, why not?
fields.Alternate1: Aced it once, no trouble acing it again.
fields.Alternate2: Okay, I can definitely do better this time.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Um... I can do better! Okay, so com..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Um... I can do better! Okay, so commonly an innocence does not enforce his or her power through military power. This is seen as unnecessary. The innocence wins because an innocence can't help but win, for their deeds are inevitabilities. Did this help?

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "An innocence is the highest categor..."
fields.Dialogue Text: An innocence is the highest category of historical personage in the world, a literal personification of History. Traditionally, an innocence, when anointed, assumes supreme rule over the Occident, or the known world in general -- at least the parts that matter.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Then go with your best guess! Isn't..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Then go with your best guess! Isn't that what students are trained to do when they don't know the answer?

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Her colours are silver, white, and..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Her colours are silver, white, and apricot. And when you think her name, Dolores, stomach acid rises to the back of your throat and it hurts -- you see a flash silver, a wreath, an airport bag. And blonde hair, you don't know why. Another choice, perhaps?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant is jolted to attenti..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant is jolted to attention by your sudden outburst. "Huh? Take what?"

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "Dolores..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dolores...

fields.Title: You: "Dolores..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dolores...

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "You can't. The idea of coming face..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You can't. The idea of coming face to face with the *Greatest Innocence* fills you with immense sadness and dread now.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "That's the spirit. Here we go! Ques..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's the spirit. Here we go! Question 1: Who was the first innocence?
fields.Alternate1: Imagine that, it's quite easy when you already know the answers, isn't it? But okay, if this makes you feel better. Here we go again. Question 1: Who was the first innocence?
fields.Alternate2: It seems rather unfair to try again after you already know the answers, but sure, if this makes you feel better. Here we go again. Question 1: Who was the first innocence?

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Incorrect. Stepan the Despicable, r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Incorrect. Stepan the Despicable, regent of Kedra, was a ruler who conquered the known world during the Kedreatic Conquest -- *instead* of the despotic Ernö Pasternak. Would you try again?

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "I've got it! Honest."
fields.Dialogue Text: I've got it! Honest.

fields.Title: You: "Franconegro."
fields.Dialogue Text: Franconegro.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Sola resigned after an assassinatio..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Sola resigned after an assassination attempt by a Yugo nationalist, who blamed her for not taking the side of the left during the turn of the century revolutions. (Innocences don't usually resign). Care to try again?

fields.Title: You: ""I put this book in it's place, tha..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I put this book in it's place, that's what. I'm so goddamn smart."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant is jolted awake by y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant is jolted awake by your furious cursing. "What's going on with you?"

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Yes. The quiz is impersonal. No nee..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes. The quiz is impersonal. No need to rouse *sensations* in yourself at the mention of Dolores Dei. Who was the *first* innocence -- it wasn't her.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Great!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Great!

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Oh yes, militarism and nationalism..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh yes, militarism and nationalism -- my bad.

fields.Title: You: "Franconegro?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Franconegro?

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Incorrect. Kedra is a large nation..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Incorrect. Kedra is a large nation in the mid-northern area of the Mundi isola, north of the Occident, between the Irmalan mountain range and the Pisantic *mare interregnum*. Care to try again?

fields.Title: You: "Not thinking about it. Not thinking..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not thinking about it. Not thinking about it. Back to quiz.

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "I don't even have to say it anymore..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I don't even have to say it anymore.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "You would have done better if you'd..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You would have done better if you'd just left Dolores Dei for the end. Dial the Dolores Dei down *a bit*.

fields.Title: You: "Close the book. [Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: Close the book. [Leave.]

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Incorrect. While she originated man..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Incorrect. While she originated many modern institutions, launched several successful expeditions, and was even critical of the innocentic system itself -- not to mention *beautiful* -- she is not often considered the *strongest*.

fields.Title: You: "Ernö Pasternak."
fields.Dialogue Text: Ernö Pasternak.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Incorrect. While Franconegro built..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Incorrect. While Franconegro built concrete churches and cathedrals, and while many people, especially the Mesque, consider him a father figure due to his militarism and nationalism, João Paolo Salomao Lopez de Fuego argues differently. Another choice, perhaps?

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "At least it clearly wasn't Dolores..."
fields.Dialogue Text: At least it clearly wasn't Dolores Dei. She wouldn't be *false*. She's beautiful.

fields.Title: You: "Okay, very interesting, but that do..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Okay, very interesting, but that doesn't help me answer the question.
fields.Alternate1: Yes, yes, so interesting, but I thought you'd give me the answer to the question.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Question 3: Who was the false innoc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Question 3: Who was the false innocence?

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Correct! The Mesque might see Franc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Correct! The Mesque might see Franconegro as the father of nations, but as of this century there's been a great shift in attitude -- Dolores Dei has become widely regarded as the greatest innocence. A most radical change to the whole fabric of the world.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "You are really just talking to your..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You are really just talking to yourself. It is quite silly.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "How is it possible that you're mess..."
fields.Dialogue Text: How is it possible that you're messing this up? Are you doing it on purpose?

fields.Title: You: ""Oh damn it, what went wrong this t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh damn it, what went wrong this time."
fields.Alternate1: "Fuck you again! You damned condescending prick. I swear, I'll rip you apart!"

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Congratulations on finishing the te..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Congratulations on finishing the test. The results and your subsequent grade have been calculated. You get...
fields.Alternate1: *Congratulations* on finishing the test again. The results and your subsequent grade have been calculated. You get...

fields.Title: You: "What?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What?

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Just steer clear of this one, okay...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Just steer clear of this one, okay. There's something terrible about this one.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Yes. There exists a group called th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes. There exists a group called the Founding Party. Known as the Holy Party during the time of the Perikarnassian. This, the world's oldest international organization, spends its time in search of either the re-emergence of the innocence, or new members.

fields.Title: The Greatest Innocence: "Incorrect. He was a violent bastard..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Incorrect. He was a violent bastard out to torture, maim and kill whoever stood in his way. He was also a *false* innocence, disqualifying him from being the greatest and most important -- and most precious to human kind. Would you like to try again?
